text: <@U033VNNBBBP> Are those sequences unique strings? Say it has 3 parts, one number, one ABC and one special character each with a meaning? Or can it be SKU made of 3 parts where all 3 parts is a number? And are these parts separated by something? Say 123-456-789 ? Or are they in one string 123456789?

Also, Im thinking. Those SKUs sound custom, like custom enough for every client having similar product with custom SKU - this would suggest you create that SKU on an ongoing basis. In process of its creation, of its assembly, you could perhaps insert yourself in the SKU creation process and adapt those custom messages from there rather than from assembled SKU.

And if its not custom made SKU and they are more or less already there, then perhaps rather than SKU using a different product characteristics that are already distinct to add information to your contacts profile.
Id be happy to chat about this, it sounds like an interesting issue.

Hi everyone,
Is there any great documentation on how to write custom code within workflows?

Looking at the sample code that has been given in the HubSpot documentation, I want to know how I can see a list of all the library functions that the code seems to be referring to.
For example:
*HubSpotClient.crm.companies.associationsApi.create* is in the code in the link <https://gist.github.com/jackcoldrick90/faa4f25eb6f07a6bc50b84589a574b3d> I would appreciate knowing how Jack Coldrick knew to use that "phrase"/object call to create the association between a company and a contact etc.
Can you direct me to where the best place to get answers for this would be.
Is there a list of all the functions the *HubSpotClient.crm* has that can be used in the custom code workflow option?
I Sara, I want to say that here you'll find (on the left side) a list of all the API docs. In your example, that would be under the CRM API section: <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/overview>
Thanks, Zeke! These will keep me busy reading for a good while!
